alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 19 at 7:54PM CDT until March 29 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana... Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Pearl River and Hancock Counties, Washington and St. Tammany Parishes. Pearl River Near Pearl River affecting Pearl River and Hancock Counties and St. Tammany Parish. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, MARCH 29... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Bogalusa. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, March 29. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Woodlands and crop acreage along the river will be flooded. The Bogue Chitto Wildlife Management area will be inundated with water in recreational camps and over access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.2 feet Monday morning then begin falling. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.2 feet on 03/23/1943. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
